body: Update rpm spec and use variables in cmake instead of hardcoded paths. How to use: 0. `yum groupinstall -y 'Development Tools' && yum install -y epel-release rpm-build && rpmdev-setuptree` 1. `cmake ${TOXCORE_SOURCES}` to generate toxcore.spec from template 2. `spectool --get-files --sourcedir toxcore.spec` <- will not work before merge, use that from my branch: `git archive --prefix 'c-toxcore-0.1.10/' -o ~/rpmbuild/SOURCES/v0.1.10.tar.gz HEAD` 3. `rpmbuild -bb toxcore.spec` Maybe setup autobuild on tags/commits? --- This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/624)

*[other/bootstrap_daemon/tox-bootstrapd.service, line 11 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/624#-L-O4JP9Np33WJmSR30i:-L-O4JP9Np33WJmSR30j:bxx4yw0) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/05c35462f3228e4814a29409bed38dcf76afcab3/other/bootstrap_daemon/tox-bootstrapd.service#L11)):*
> ```
> PIDFile=/var/run/tox-bootstrapd/tox-bootstrapd.pid
> WorkingDirectory=/var/lib/tox-bootstrapd
> ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/tox-bootstrapd --config /etc/tox-bootstrapd.conf
> ```

This change also affects non RPM builds, I don't think it's a good idea to install into `/usr/*` by default.

Copied service file in rpm directory for distribution. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/624)*

How to build without cmake:
With SRPM
1. `cd other/rpm`
2. `make srpm`
3. `mock --rebuild *.src.rpm` or any other way to build srpm
Version for package will be taken from `git describe` and source archive will be generated with `git archive`.

With .spec and copr:
1. `cd other/rpm`
2. `make spec`
3. `copr build toxcore toxcore.spec`
Version for package will be taken from `git describe` and source archive will be downloaded from github.
